verses.name: Mark 4:29
verses.text: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.

verses.name: Mark 4:30
verses.text: And he said, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?

verses.name: Mark 4:31
verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:

verses.name: Mark 4:32
verses.text: But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.
